page.title: 04FENTON-ORIGINS
page.content: Fenton, not mentioned in the 1086 survey, must have come into existence at some later date. The village stands on some low lying land between the rivers Witham and the Brant, suggesting that the name derives from the fact that it is the "town in the fen". It is the smallest of our three villages and at the 1981 census had a population of 68 with 20 households. The church and churchyard are used only on special occasions. Most of the houses are of red brick apart from the old part of the farm near the church which contains part of the remains of Fenton Hall. There are four farms in the village and the land contained in our block is wholly arable.
